title: HTMLPage Title

metadata.description: Learn about HTMLPage Title with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Every web page should have a page title to describe the meaning of the page.
The Title Element
The
<title>
element adds a title 
to your page:
Example
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<title>HTML Tutorial</title>
</head>
<body>
The content of the document......
</body>
</html>
The title is shown in the browser's title bar:
What is a Good Title?
The title should describe the content and the meaning of the page.
The page title is very important for search engine optimization 
(SEO). The text is used by search engine algorithms to decide the order 
when listing pages in search results.
The
<title>
element:
defines a title in the browser toolbar
provides a title for the page when it is added to favorites
displays a title for the page in search engine-results
So, try to make the title as accurate and meaningful as possible!
HTML Title Tag
Tag
Description
<title>
Defines the title of the document
For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our
HTML Tag Reference
.

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers HTMLPage Title concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use HTMLPage Title effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of HTMLPage Title and how to apply it in your projects.
